Scholasticism

Turtle | RDF/XML | N-Triples | JSON-LD | GitHub
owl:Ontology
dct:contributor
Roberta Padlina, project coordinator and software developer, Basel University, Switzerland
Prof. Dr. Ueli Zahnd, Institut D'histoire De La Réformation, University of Geneva, Switzerland (en)
Gabriel Müller, Faculty of Theology, University of Basel, Switzerland (en)
dct:creator
Hans Cools, MD, knowledge engineer, ontologist, software developer, NIE, University of Basel, Switzerland
dct:description
Formal description of elements in Scholasticism.
dct:license
http://creativecommons.org/ licenses/ by/ 3.0/
dct:publisher
Universities of Basel, Bern, and Zürich, Switzerland
dct:title
An ontology about Scholasticism
owl:versionInfo
2020-06-11

scholasticism:Scholastic
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
An adherent of Scholasticism.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
scholasticism:
rdfs:label
ScholastikerIn (de)
scholastic (en)
skos:note
There are no female scholastics because women were not allowed to universities in the era of scholasticism.
rdfs:subClassOf
human:Person
scholasticism:Scholasticism
a
rdfs:Class
rdfs:comment
Method of critical thought dominating theological and philosophical study in Western Christianity and teaching by academics or scholastics (schoolmen) of universities in Europe from about 1100 to 1700.
rdfs:isDefinedBy
scholasticism:
rdfs:label
Scholastik (de)
scholasticism (en)
rdfs:subClassOf
concept:ThoughtMethod
